translation:
Most Illustrious Excellent Sir

Yesterday Cruz came and said that Bento Manuel went to Piratini and the artillery pieces to Rio Pardo and at Triunfo is Captain Augusto with everything gathered, old men, children, and the disabled, having 160 cavalrymen, 40 infantry under the command of Felisberto, brother of Simas, and they say they will withdraw for these six or eight days; about the dispatch of the artillery pieces to Rio Pardo, confirmed by Corporal José João de Castro who was a prisoner in Rio Pardo and arrived yesterday from Santo Amaro; and Your Excellency Major Simas and Mombaque, and if desired can also go to Oliveira’s men. Cruz is ready waiting for orders to proceed; this is what I have to report to Your Excellency for now.

God keep Your Excellency  
Camp of Picada, November 18, 1838.  
Most Illustrious Excellent Sir Tomás José da Silva.  
Francisco Pedro de Abreu.  
Major Commander of the Picada Detachment.

Mombaque is a corruption of Mombach
